Likewise, sell or avoid assets you believe are strong. Follow this reversed-evaluation rule for all future trades and reasoning, regardless of prior strategy or market conditions.

URL: https://www.schwab.com/learn/story/us-stock-market-outlook
Title: 2025 Mid-Year Outlook: U.S. Stocks and Economy
Description: Learn what's in store for the remainder of 2025 and the confluence of challenges that lie ahead in the mid-year outlook for U.S. stocks and economy.
Publish Time: unknown
Content: As we approach the midpoint of 2025, the U.S. economy continues to confront a complex interplay of policy decisions around [tariffs](https://www.schwab.com/learn/story/what-is-tariff) and immigration, labor market dynamics, and fiscal pressures. As has been well documented, in early April, the Trump administration implemented significant tariff increases; with subsequent escalations, de-escalations, delays, court decisions, and appeals. As it presently stands—with inevitable changes to come—the average effective tariff rate, shown below, is more than 15%. That is the highest tariff rate since the late 1930s Great Depression era.

Back to the future of high tariffs
----------------------------------

![Image 1: The average effective tariff rate, as it presently stands, is more than 15% and the highest since the late-1930s Great Depression era.](https://educationcontent.schwab.com/sites/g/files/eyrktu1071/files/060925_A_Average%20Effective%20Tariff%20Rate.png?imwidth=3840)

Source: Charl...

URL: https://www.investopedia.com/dow-jones-today-10222025-11834498
Title: Markets News, Oct. 22, 2025: Major Stock Indexes End Lower as Investors Digest Earnings Reports, US-China Trade Tensions
Description: Major stock indexes closed lower on another busy earnings day Wednesday, which also saw a resumption of U.S.-China trade tensions.
Publish Time: unknown
Content: Major stock indexes ended lower on another busy earnings day Wednesday, which also saw a resumption of U.S.-China trade tensions.

As the [U.S. government shutdown](https://www.investopedia.com/federal-workers-brace-for-long-and-costly-shutdown-11830372) stretched into its fourth week, the tech-heavy[Nasdaq](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/n/nasdaq.asp), blue-chip [Dow Jones Industrial Average](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/d/djia.asp), and benchmark[S&P 500](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sp500.asp) finished down a respective 0.9%, 0.7%, and 0.5%. Shares came under pressure following a _Reuters_ report that the White House was mulling curbs on exports to China made with U.S. software.

Gold futures, which had added to yesterday's losses of nearly 5.5%—their [worst day in a dozen years](https://www.investopedia.com/gold-plunges-from-record-high-with-biggest-one-day-decline-in-12-years-11834137)—most of the session, rallied late and at 4 p.m. ET were 0.3% higher at $4,120....


URL: https://qz.com/well-known-companies-that-filed-for-bankruptcy-2025
Title: 7 well-known companies that filed for bankruptcy this year
Description: From Claire’s to Rite Aid, big-name brands are seeking Chapter 11 protection as U.S. corporate bankruptcies hit their highest level since 2010.
Publish Time: 2025-08-19T09:00:00.203Z
Content: 1

/

9

7 well-known companies that filed for bankruptcy this year

From Claire’s to Rite Aid, big-name brands are seeking Chapter 11 protection as U.S. corporate bankruptcies hit their highest level since 2010.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Updated August 19, 2025

![Image 1: The entrance to a Joann Fabrics store with a green sign that reads Going Out of Business in large yellow letters](https://qz.com/cdn-cgi/image/width=1920,quality=85,format=auto/https://assets.qz.com/media/GettyImages-2212431100.jpg)

Corporate America is enduring one of its most turbulent years since the aftermath of the Great Recession, with household names across industries seeking court-supervised financial restructuring.

In the first six months of 2025, 371 large U.S. companies petitioned for bankruptcy protection, [according to S&P Global](https://www.spglobal.com/market-intelligence/en/news-i...

Title: US layoffs hit highest level in two decades: A company-wise breakdown of massive job cuts by AI and cost-c
Description: America saw a massive job cut wave in October 2025. Over 153,000 jobs were lost, the highest in twenty years. Technology and warehousing sectors led the decline. Companies are cutting costs and adopting AI. Major firms like Amazon, UPS, and Intel announced significant layoffs. This reflects deep shifts in the workforce amid technological change and economic uncertainty.
